Leave for Death or Illness of Relatives
Leave of absence, with pay, on account of the funeral or death of a relative,
is approved without prior request provided such privilege is not abused. Up
to three days leave with pay may be provided at the death of a ■ member of
the immediate family. Up to one day of leave with pay is granted for attend¬
ing the funeral of a relative outside the immediate household or family.
"Members of the immediate family" is interpreted to mean either of the
following:
1. Person of close relationship, such as: father or mother, father-in-law
or mother-in-law, brother or sister, husband or wife, child, son-in-law or
daughter-in-law.
2. Relative living with the employee, such as: aunt or uncle, grandparent,
or cousin.
Approved absence because of serious illness in the immediate family can be
charged to normal disability leave upon request of the employee. Approved
absence up to one-half day to attend a funeral of a non-relative may be
charged to disability leave.
Absence for Jury or Witness Service
Employees serving as jurors or witnesses shall receive regular pay from
ine MSB during the time of such service. However, pay for such leaves
will be computed as the difference between the amount paid for the service
and the regular full time salary of the person on such leave.
Absence for Visit to Doctor or Dentist
All absences because of visits to doctors or dentists for reasons of personal
health are charged to the employee's disability leave.
Extended Disability Leave
Permanent employees are entitled to an extended disability leave of one
work week with pay for each year of service, cumulative to a total of ten
work weeks, which shall be allowed to reaccumulate to this maximum through
additional service after being used in full or in part. Extended disability
leave is not to be used until the normal disability leave has been used.
